item.title: China’s Big Spenders Pull Back, as Stock Market Shudders
item.description: China’s upper crust represents as much as a third of global luxury spending. The tumult in China’s financial markets is denting that, leaving retailers anxious.
item.dc:creator: HIROKO TABUCHI and AMIE TSANG
item.media:credit: Xaume Olleros/Bloomberg News, via Getty Images
item.media:description: Waiting for customers at a Rolex store in the Causeway Bay section of Hong Kong. Spending on luxury goods in China contracted 1 percent last year, to about $18 billion.

item.title: Days of Unrest Turn Deadly in Indian State of Gujarat
item.description: The clashes, in which as many as eight people were killed, came amid protests by members of the Patidar caste who are demanding job opportunities.
item.dc:creator: NIDA NAJAR

item.title: Migrant or Refugee? There Is a Difference, With Legal Implications
item.description: The terms are sometimes used interchangeably, but international law distinguishes between people fleeing war and persecution and others, affecting how they are treated in foreign countries.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: SOMINI SENGUPTA
item.media:credit: Sergey Ponomarev for The New York Times
item.media:description: Migrants who had come through Greece rode a train through Macedonia on Wednesday.

item.title: U.S. Stock Markets Close Higher for 2nd Day as Global Shares Rebound
item.description: The S.&P. 500 and the Dow rose strongly and the Nasdaq turned positive for the year as better economic news buoyed trading.
item.category: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
item.dc:creator: PETER EAVIS and AMIE TSANG
item.media:description: A trader on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange on Thursday.

item.title: ISIS Suicide Attack Kills 2 Iraqi Generals Near Ramadi
item.description: The generals were killed by two explosives-rigged American-made Humvees, dealing another setback to the faltering campaign to retake Anbar Province.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: TIM ARANGO

item.title: Junaid Hussain, ISIS Recruiter, Reported Killed in Airstrike
item.description: Mr. Hussain, a 21-year-old Briton, hacked into American military networks and was a central figure in the Islamic State’s online recruitment campaign.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA

item.title: Austria Finds Up to 50 Bodies Thought to Be of Migrants in Truck
item.description: The precise toll is yet to be determined, a police official said, after the vehicle was found abandoned on a highway east of Vienna.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: ALISON SMALE
item.media:description: An abandoned truck carrying the dead bodies of people assumed to be migrants was found in Austria on Thursday.

item.title: Beirut Journal: Growing Trash Piles Reflect Lebanon’s Political Gridlock
item.description: To protesters, the garbage piles are one indignity too far, the ultimate manifestation of a failed system that has left the state unable to perform basic functions.
item.dc:creator: ANNE BARNARD
item.media:description: A man sifted through garbage piled in Beirut, Lebanon, on Monday.

item.title: Google Denies Europe’s Antitrust Accusations
item.description: The American technology giant would face fines worth billions of dollars if it is found to have broken the European Union’s competition rules.
item.dc:creator: MARK SCOTT
item.media:description: Sundar Pichai, the new chief executive of Google, whose response to the antitrust charges comes two weeks after it said it was reorganizing its business units under a new name, Alphabet.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: The Costs of Malay Supremacy
item.description: Malaysia must abandon its pro-Malay affirmative action policies: They weaken the economy and good governance.
item.dc:creator: JAMES CHIN

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Hong Kong Student Leaders Charged for Actions That Ignited ‘Umbrella Movement’
item.description: Alex Chow, the former leader of the Hong Kong Federation of Students, was charged with unlawful assembly. Nathan Law, the current leader of the federation, was charged with inciting others to take part. Joshua Wong, who co-founded the youth group Scholarism, was charged with both offenses.
item.dc:creator: ALAN WONG
item.media:description: Joshua Wong, left, and Nathan Law, center, talking to reporters on Thursday outside the Wan Chai police station in Hong Kong.

item.title: Francis Sejersted, 79, Dies; Steered Nobel Peace Prize Into Controversy
item.description: Mr. Sejersted led a committee that angered many by giving the awards to Shimon Peres, Yitzhak Rabin and Yasir Arafat, and to F. W. de Klerk and Nelson Mandela.
item.dc:creator: BRUCE WEBER
item.media:description: Nelson Mandela, left; Francis Sejersted, chairman of the Nobel Peace Prize Committee, center; and F. W. de Klerk, the president of South Africa, after Mr. Mandela and Mr. de Klerk received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1993.

item.title: China Sentences 45 in Restive Region of Xinjiang
item.description: The names of the defendants indicated that they were Uighurs, a Turkic minority in the ethnically volatile region that has become increasingly estranged from the government.
item.dc:creator: CHRIS BUCKLEY

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Beijing Smog Gives Way to ‘Military Parade Blue’ Before World War II Event
item.description: The city has been pulling out all the stops to ensure that the commemoration next week will not be clouded in the city’s usually poor air.
item.dc:creator: PATRICK BOEHLER
item.media:description: A man bicycling past Tiananmen gate in Beijing this weekend against skies some local residents have called "military parade blue."

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Q. and A.: Charles Yang on Greed, Gambling and Turmoil in China’s Markets
item.description: Mr. Yang discussed the government’s handling of the economy, why greed is not good and what investors might learn from the ancient Taoist philosopher Laotzu.
item.dc:creator: DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW
item.media:description: An electronic board displaying stock information at a brokerage house in Beijing earlier this week.

item.title: Renewed Scrutiny for Mosque in Spain After Foiled Train Attack
item.description: The authorities say a mosque played a crucial role in the transformation of the suspect, Ayoub El Khazzani, but its members say the preaching there was not to blame.
item.dc:creator: RAPHAEL MINDER
item.media:credit: Laura Leon for The New York Times
item.media:description: Mohamed Ali Mustafa Amar, a member of the Taqwa mosque association, at the mosque in Algeciras, Spain. Ayoub El Khazzani's ties to the mosque led the Spanish authorities to put him under surveillance.

item.title: Ukraine Agrees on Plan to Restructure $18 Billion of Foreign Debt
item.description: The deal would write off 20 percent of the country’s overseas obligations and go far to help avoid a drawn-out, Greek-style negotiation with large bondholders.
item.category: Franklin Templeton Limited Duration Income Trust
item.dc:creator: ANDREW E. KRAMER

item.title: Feature: The Lessons of Anwar al-Awlaki
item.description: Four years after the United States assassinated the radical cleric in a drone strike, his influence on jihadists is greater than ever. Was there a better way to stop him?
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: SCOTT SHANE

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: America’s Dangerous Bargain With Turkey
item.description: By attacking Kurds, Turkey is undermining the United States’ strongest ally in the fight against the Islamic State.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ERIC S. EDELMAN
item.media:description: A demonstration against the Kurdistan Workers' Party on August 16 in Istanbul.

item.title: China Holds 23 Linked to Fatal Blasts in Tianjin
item.description: Chinese leaders have moved vigorously in recent days to quell outrage over the blasts, which rattled top leaders and raised questions about the safety of China’s industrial zones.
item.category: Rui Hai International Logistics Co Ltd
item.dc:creator: JAVIER C. HERNÁNDEZ
